intro: Dichanthelium oligosanthes var. scribnerianum, commonly known as Scribner's panicum, is a grass species native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, acidic soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are characteristic of the Panicum genus. It is often found in association with other wetland vegetation, contributing to the ecological diversity of these environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various wildlife species.
